articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: The Trump administration's freeze of foreign funding has begun impacting an international effort to hold Russia responsible for alleged war crimes in Ukraine, according to eight sources and a Ukrainian document seen by Reuters, halting dozens of jobs and tens of millions of dollars in aid.
articles.title: U.S. funding freeze threatens Ukraine investigations of alleged Russian war crimes

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Donald Trump is expected to introduce new 25% tariffs on Monday on all steel and aluminium imports into the U.S., on top of existing metals duties, in another major escalation of his shake-up of trade policy.
articles.title: Trump to announce 25% steel and aluminium tariffs in latest trade salvo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Overnight Russian drone attacks sparked a fire in Kyiv and injured a woman and damaged several houses in the northeastern city of Sumy, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia launches drone attacks on Kyiv, Sumy, Ukrainian officials say

articles.author: Wendell Roelf
articles.description: The party of South Africa's ex-president Jacob Zuma on Monday filed a treason complaint against AfriForum, a group championing the white Afrikaner minority, after Donald Trump attacked the country's new law aimed at redistributing white-owned land.
articles.title: South African party accuses white group of treason over Trump attack

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Monday it could neither confirm nor deny whether or not Russian President Vladimir Putin had spoken to U.S. President Donald Trump by phone about finding a way to stop the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Kremlin adopts cryptic stance on contacts between Putin and Trump
At least 50 die in Guatemala after bus plunges off bridge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas' armed wing will delay the release of more Israeli hostages planned for Saturday until further notice, according to a statement by the group's spokesperson on Telegram.
articles.title: Hamas' armed wing says it will delay hostage release scheduled for Saturday

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Some U.S.-funded media outlets that report on Cuba are seeking alternative sources of financing while the Trump administration pursues a plan to dismantle the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), leaving their fate in limbo.
articles.title: US-funded Cuban media in limbo after Trump orders USAID closed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of students protested in the Bosnian capital Sarajevo on Monday over the failure of authorities to take responsibility for the deaths of 27 people in devastating floods in early October or to promptly help survivors.
articles.title: Bosnian students protest government inaction after deadly floods

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: An April presidential run-off in Ecuador will pit incumbent Daniel Noboa against leftist Luisa Gonzalez, in an unexpectedly tight contest featuring the same two candidates as a 2023 snap election.
articles.title: Ecuador presidential vote pits incumbent against leftist in rerun of 2023 run-off
